snippet: The Afghan president’s spokesman said Saturday that last week’s civilian casualties during a raid on Taliban fighters in eastern Afghanistan were unacceptable.
abstract: Afghanistan government rebukes American officials, saying that the civilian casualties during a NATO-Afghan raid on Taliban fighters in eastern Afghanistan are unacceptable, not only because of the loss of innocent life but also because Afghan forces were not involved in the decision to call in an airstrike.

byline.original: By SANGAR RAHIMI and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi reported from Kabul, and Alissa J. Rubin from Mazar-i-Sharif, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The Afghan president’s spokesman said Saturday that last week’s civilian casualties during a raid on Taliban fighters in eastern Afghanistan were unacceptable.

headline.seo: Afghan Official Rebukes NATO for Civilian Deaths
headline.main: Afghan Official Rebukes NATO for Civilian Deaths
headline.print_headline: Afghan Official Rebukes NATO for Civilian Deaths
